Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery covered cup with offset rim; interior reserved; exterior: traces of two narrow brown bands at top; below, black-figure decoration consisting of leg of male to right, in some form of crouched position; at right, lower leg or legs in added white of female to right in near horizontal position; below, wide black band partly fired red; lowest part of sherd reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is one of four non-joining sherds belonging to the same vessel, designated here as AN1896-1908-G.1005 (1) - (4).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 429, no. B685)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0723) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
